00170 #ifdef __WXMAC__
00171 
00172 // On Mac OS X, it's better not to use the wxThread class.
00173 // We use our own implementation based on pthreads instead.
00174 
00175 class ODManagerHelperThread {
00176  public:
00177    typedef int ExitCode;
00178    ODManagerHelperThread() { mDestroy = false; mThread = NULL; }
00179   /* ExitCode*/ void Entry(){
00180          ODManager::Instance()->Start();
00181    }
00182 
00183    void Create() {}
00184    void Delete() {
00185       mDestroy = true;
00186       pthread_join(mThread, NULL);
00187    }
00188    bool TestDestroy() { return mDestroy; }
00189    void Sleep(int ms) {
00190       struct timespec spec;
00191       spec.tv_sec = 0;
00192       spec.tv_nsec = ms * 1000 * 1000;
00193       nanosleep(&spec, NULL);
00194    }
00195    static void *callback(void *p) {
00196       ODManagerHelperThread *th = (ODManagerHelperThread *)p;
00197       /* return (void *) */th->Entry();
00198    }
00199    
00202    void SetPriority(int priority)
00203    {
00204       mPriority=priority;
00205    }
00206    
00207    void Run() {
00208       pthread_create(&mThread, NULL, callback, this);
00209    }
00210  private:
00211    bool mDestroy;
00212    pthread_t mThread;
00213    
00214    int mPriority;
00215 
00216 };
00217 
00218 #else
00219 
00220    class ODManagerHelperThread : public wxThread  
00221    {
00222       public:
00225       ODManagerHelperThread(): wxThread(){}
00226    
00227       protected:
00229       void *Entry()
00230       {
00231          ODManager::Instance()->Start();
00232          return NULL;
00233       }
00234      
00235    };
00236    
00237 #endif //__WXMAC__
